channel.title: Project
channel.description:
Hi, I am looking for dedicated project to work on. I would need a partner with financial funds. I have a big experience in RSPS. I can program almost anything needed for a good unique RSPS start. I am pretty sure so many people could vouch me. My main goal is to get far.
- Mod Artem from SoulSplit's Team.

item.title: Project
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

I know you are dedicated to every project you are apart of, so I can vouch for you on that matter. Also, if you need someone to support financial needs you might want to explain what these financial fees would be, and the estimate of the overall cost.

Read full topic

item.title: Project
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:10, topic:509886”][quote author=Ruby link=topic=628131.msg4267590#msg4267590 date=1364235402]

Soulsplit’s crap anyway, I don’t know how its got to where it is now.

It isn’t crap, it’s professionally run and well designed, they have no lagg, close to no down time a very well managed community; of course it’s going to be huge. I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again, it isn’t about the content it’s about the way a server is run.
[/quote]

feel free to spend a shit load of money on a dedi and server lag is only caused by poor coding/bad hosting.[/quote]
Well players aren’t going to join an RSPS with a tonne of lag, well, they might join but they certainly won’t stay. Players are with SoulSplit because they give what the players want, it’s as simple as that. All of these servers with unique features here and there often don’t have a large player base simply because they’re run terribly (not all, most). For example, I hosted a leeched PI to over 600 players, I have little to no Java knowledge. It’s the way you present the server and the service you provide.

Read full topic
